name: Great Britain
hint: Largest island in Europe, home to England, Scotland, and Wales

name: Iceland
hint: Land of fire and ice in the North Atlantic, famous for geysers and volcanoes

name: Ireland
hint: The Emerald Isle, second-largest island in the British Isles

name: Sicily
hint: Largest island in the Mediterranean Sea, home to Mount Etna

name: Sardinia
hint: Second-largest Mediterranean island, known for pristine beaches and Bronze Age ruins

name: Crete
hint: Largest Greek island, birthplace of the ancient Minoan civilization

name: Corsica
hint: French island in the Mediterranean, birthplace of Napoleon Bonaparte

name: Mallorca
hint: Largest of Spain's Balearic Islands, a hugely popular Mediterranean holiday destination

name: Svalbard
hint: Remote Norwegian Arctic archipelago where polar bears outnumber people

name: Faroe Islands
hint: Danish autonomous territory in the North Atlantic, known for dramatic sea cliffs

name: Santorini
hint: Iconic Greek volcanic island with white-washed buildings and spectacular caldera views

name: Malta
hint: Small island nation south of Sicily with megalithic temples older than the pyramids

name: Gotland
hint: Sweden's largest island in the Baltic Sea, rich in Viking and medieval history

name: Lofoten Islands
hint: Dramatic Norwegian Arctic archipelago known for fishing villages and northern lights

name: Tenerife
hint: Largest Canary Island, home to Spain's highest peak, Mount Teide
